alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 20 at 3:17AM MDT until March 21 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW RETURNS TO THE MOUNTAINS MONDAY... .The first in a series of Pacific storm systems will bring snow to the Colorado mountains today. For the northern mountains, snow is expected to begin today and increase in intensity tonight. Snow comes to end Tuesday morning. This snow free period will be temporary as snow is expected to return to the northern mountains Tuesday night or Wednesday when the next Pacific system moves into the Central Rockies. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Roads will become slippery in spots, especially through mountain passes. Use caution when traveling.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
